design_1.name: Lynx
design_1.description: Czech Republic proposal; a fictional substance in the novel Továrna na absolutno by Karel Čapek.

design_2.name: Eridanus
design_2.description: The name was originally Arabic: آخر النهر āẖir an-nahr ('river's end').

design_3.name: Cassiopeia
design_3.description: Apparently first applied to η Cassiopeiae in the Skalnate Pleso Atlas of the Heavens published in 1950, but is not known prior to that.

design_4.name: Scorpius
design_4.description: The traditional name of the β Scorpii system has been rendered Akrab and Elakrab, derived (like Acrab) from Arabic: العقرب al-ʿaqrab ('the scorpion').

design_5.name: Crux
design_5.description: Acrux is a modern contraction of the Bayer designation, coined in the 19th century, but which entered into common use only by the mid-20th century.

design_6.name: Cancer
design_6.description: The name was originally Arabic: الزبانى az-zubāná ('the claws').

design_7.name: Canis Major
design_7.description: The name is originally from Arabic: عذارى ʿaḏārá ('virgins'). In the Calendarium of Al Achsasi Al Mouakket, it is designated أول العذاري awwil al-ʿaḏāriyy, translated into Latin as Prima Virginum ('first virgin').

design_8.name: Andromeda
design_8.description: The name was originally Arabic: الذيل aḏ-ḏayl (the train, lit. 'the tail').

design_9.name: Taurus
design_9.description: The name is originally from Arabic: عين ʿayn ('eye') and was reviewed and adopted by the Working Group on Star Names.

design_10.name: Sagittarius
design_10.description: From Arabic: عين الرامي ʿayn ar-rāmī ('eye of the archer').

design_11.name: Lyra
design_11.description: The name is originally from Arabic: الأظفر al-uẓfur ('the talons' [of the swooping eagle]), shared with μ Lyrae (Alathfar).

design_12.name: Serpens
design_12.description: Cypriot proposal; first historically recorded name of Cyprus (mid-15th century).

design_13.name: Cygnus
design_13.description: The source of the name Albireo is not entirely clear.

design_15.name: Cepheus
design_15.description: From Arabic: الذراع اليمين aḏ-ḏirāʿ al-yamīn ('the right arm' [of Cepheus]).

design_16.name: Grus
design_16.description: The name was originally الذنب aḏ-ḏanab ('the tail' [of the constellation of the Southern Fish]).

design_18.name: Pegasus
design_18.description: From Arabic: الجانب al-jānib ('the flank'). Algenib is also another name for alfa Persei (Mirfak).

design_19.name: Perseus
design_19.description: From Arabic: رأس الغول ra's al-ġūl ('head of the ogre'). In Egyptian, Horus.

design_20.name: Canis Major
design_20.description: Nigerian proposal; named after Amadioha, a god in Igbo mythology.
